sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services

Class ServiceGroup<S extends Service>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingCollection<E>
        • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingSet<S>
          • sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services.ServiceGroup<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the common supertype that all services must share
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<S>, java.util.Collection<S>, java.util.Set<S>

    public final class ServiceGroup<S extends Service>
extends com.google.common.collect.ForwardingSet<S>
    An immutable set of Service instances user-specified iteration order. Does not permit null elements.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell

      • of

        public static final <S extends Service> ServiceGroup<S> of(S first,
                                     S second)
        Returns a service group containing the given services, in order. Repeated occurrences of a service (according to Object.equals(java.lang.Object)) after the first are ignored.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any service is null

      • of

        @SafeVarargs
public static final <S extends Service> ServiceGroup<S> of(S first,
                                                 S second,
                                                 S... rest)
        Returns a service group containing the given services, in order. Repeated occurrences of a service (according to Object.equals(java.lang.Object)) after the first are ignored.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any service is null

      • waitForState

        public final void waitForState(com.google.common.util.concurrent.Service.State state)
        Waits for all services to be in the given state. This method blocks until all services are in the desired state.
        Parameters:
        state - the state, not null
